PositionHistory.Title: Service Delivery Manager
PositionHistory.Description: As a member of the Support organization, my focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales non-technical customer inquiries via phone and electronic means, as well as, technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting for our Electronic Support Services. A primary point of contact for customers, I'm responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues. Coordinate tasks between all Cloud Managed Service Teams, and guarantee the commitment of the Service level Agreement and P&L. Considered the lead customer liaison for Banesco Banco Universal (Venezuela) and Banesco Seguros (Dominican Republic & Venezuela), top-revenue Support accounts, and will attend one-on-one meetings with representatives of the strategic accounts. Responsible for managing internal projects, such as creating internal training curricula and schedules, presenting across lines of businesses, identifying and driving productivity improvement opportunities, coordinating, preparing and qualifying Premier Analysts for Customer Visits and employee mentoring.

PositionHistory.Title: LATAM Project Manager
International Project Management
PositionHistory.Description: Manage complex new product implementation and executions. Provide both technical and business leadership to multi-functional new product teams and lead them to deliver initiatives that provide the highest possible ROI for the Company. Reduce execution times and system costs through the promotion of consistent work practices, efficient use of assets and strategic planning. Ensure that teams adequately analyze data, design in contingencies, communicate and get buy-in from Management on risks associated with their projects. Expand the Company's Project Management capabilities by providing "project management process leadership" to the project management function as well as the businesses that are supported. Coach and mentor other team leads in project leadership.

PositionHistory.Title: IT Project Manager
PositionHistory.Description: Responsible for delivering and launching in Latam markets a new System Web based to manage electronic health record (EHR) or also known as electronic patient record (EPR) and driving day-to-day issue resolution in order to meet the technology requirements. Research, evaluate, recommend and potentially implement new technologies, features, services and equipment to best support current markets' needs. Ensure that the team meets project objectives and deliverables on-time and within budget. Manages work integration, scope, expectations, quality, time, cost, risk, procurement and communication for the team and stakeholders. Lead and oversee the design, development and implementation phases of the project, coordinate with the stakeholders. Establish, maintain and encourage high quality standards.

PositionHistory.Title: Project Leader
PositionHistory.Description: Responsible to increase the network coverage adding up 125 E1s to the UMTS platform, and migrating the technology from UMTS to IP in parallel.

PositionHistory.Title: Project Manager - Innovative Research & Development
PositionHistory.Description: Created, established and managed the North America Project Management Office (PMO). Oversaw the management of IR&D projects from inception to closure to ensure they were completed on time and within budget. Provided overall coordination across the full range of activities associated with the planning, design and execution of 20 simultaneous projects involving 19 cross functional team members. Assembled management tools to identify and resolve issues, both inter and intra-departmental, to ensure objectives were successfully met. Supported the implementation of Oracle Project Accounting system and Hyperion Planning system in Teva Neuroscience IR&D. Evaluated and reported performance metrics across various departments within the organization and provided the core management team with a continuous analytical view of the studies' progress and probability to meet timelines.

PositionHistory.Title: Mentor
PositionHistory.Description: Coordinate both manufacturing and laboratory activities to comply with GlaxoSmithKline's commitments to the Food and Drug Administration (FDA). Develop and maintain detailed schedule and resource utilization plans on Primavera 5.0. Implement a Quality Management System (QMS), which improve the management of Standard Operating Procedures' (SOPs). Serve as the scheduler for various projects, providing guidance across the full range of activities associated with the work plan.

PositionHistory.Title: Project Manager
PositionHistory.Description: Interfaced with Commercial, Donor Site and Senior Management, to keep them engaged and aligned with the Company's goals and objectives. Steered, coached and led the Technical Support department in order to deliver successful project results and customer satisfaction. Developed and maintained detailed site schedule and resource utilization plans in Microsoft Project for more than 12 new products introductions (NPI) within different manufacturing lines. Managed 3rd Party Contract manufacturing projects and exceed the clients' expectations (McNeil, J&J, Roche and Bayer). Worked with stream leads / team members to ensure project parameters were successfully developed and defined in the Project Execution Plan (PEP). Identified and tracked all the critical paths of GPD transfers and new launches to advise management on priorities, forecast completion dates and deviations from the work plan. Prepared periodical reports for all stakeholders, including Senior Management and Customers, that provided full visibility of the progress achieved ("S" curves). Supervised contractors and consultants to ensure that their schedules were realistic fully challenged and completed within the planned timeframes.

Provided project controls and scheduling expertise for the Puerto Rico site ``Strategic Master Plan'' program while coordinating global activities with sites in Poland, Mexico, Brazil, Hungary, Italy and the USA, receiving 100+ products from 13 sites. Developed, maintained and monitored site schedule to measure the team's performance. Created and developed multi-site reporting method, interfacing business functions, site leadership and corporate senior management. Coordinated product transfer meetings with global site teams and corporate.

PositionHistory.Title: Project Planner
Project Leader
PositionHistory.Description: Glaxo Wellcome / GlaxoSmithKline (Caracas, Venezuela) Project Coordinator & Planner - Y2K Validation ,

PositionHistory.Title: Project Coordinator
PositionHistory.Description: Validation of local software on HP3000 Server System Analyst and Progress V8 Programmer

PositionHistory.Title: System Analyst
Progress V8 Programmer
PositionHistory.Description: Education: BS Systems Engineer (2003), Universidad Santa Maria, Caracas, Venezuela

Competency.name: managed the North America Project Management Office

{{DOCUMENT_DATESTAMP}} 2014-6-26 {{END_DOCUMENT_DATESTAMP}}
CÉSAR A. SÁNCHEZ I. Av. Ppal. de Lomas de Pdos. del Este, Res. Giancarlo, PH-2 * Baruta, Miranda - Venezuela cesarasanchezi@hotmail.com * Cel +58-414-923-5028 http://www.linkedin.com/in/cesarasanchezi
PROFESSIONAL PROFILE
* Goal-oriented Project Manager with comprehensive experience managing technical and Business Process Improvement (BPI) projects in various functional areas, across all project phases. ; * Innovative and strategic thinker recognized for an innate ability to improve processes that yield operational excellence and positive fiscal results. ; * Over 13 years of Domestic and International project experience including: manufacturing operations, ITIL and Web Systems (Cloud), 3rd party contract manufacturing, supplier network rationalization (USA, Europe, LATAM), PMO Management, Operational Excellence (Lean6Sigma), FDA regulations, Clinical Studies (CTMS), quality assurance systems, systems validations, Global Strategic Sourcing and Supply chain, and inventory management. ; * Proven expertise in driving teams achieving project goals, facilitating project planning, tracking project costs and schedules, and ensuring that the delivered product meets the customer's expectations for quality and functionality.
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

A primary point of contact for customers, I'm responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues. Coordinate tasks between all Cloud Managed Service Teams, and guarantee the commitment of the Service level Agreement and P&L. Considered the lead customer liaison for Banesco Banco Universal (Venezuela) and Banesco Seguros (Dominican Republic & Venezuela), top-revenue Support accounts, and will attend one-on-one meetings with representatives of the strategic accounts. ExperienceSummary.ExecutiveBrief: César A. Sánchez is a resident of Baruta, Miranda, VE. He has been working in the IT occupational sector for more than 16 years. Currently he is employed as a Service Delivery Manager at Oracle Managed Cloud Services. César has extensive knowledge of Oracle, UMTS, Microsoft Project, IP, Hyperion Pillar-Budgeting & Planning, HP Server Hardware > HP 3000 Servers. César has an extensive management experience (10.9 years).
ExperienceSummary.ManagementRecord: Currently since 2013-07 the candidate had experience at a lower grade management level working as a Service Delivery Manager/International Project Management at Oracle Managed Cloud Services. Since 2012-02 for 17 months the candidate had experience at a lower grade management level working as a LATAM Project Manager/International Project Management at The Clorox Company. Since 2010-06 for 21 months the candidate had experience at a lower grade management level working as a IT Project Manager/International Project Management at Corporación Astir. Since 2010-02 for 3 months the candidate had experience at a lower grade management level working as a Project Leader/International Project Management at Telefónica Venezuela - Movistar. Since 2007-03 for 33 months the candidate had experience at a lower grade management level working as a Project Manager - Innovative Research & Development/International Project Management at Teva Neuroscience, Inc.. Since 2005-05 for 19 months the candidate had experience at a lower grade management level working as a Project Manager/International Project Management at Valeant Puerto Rico LLC. Since 2000-10 for 26 months the candidate had experience at a lower grade management level working as a Project Planner/International Project Management at Glaxo Wellcome.
